skill.author: DCjanus

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate UI/UX design knowledge base tool. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misidentifying design-related content. Hex color codes are misclassified as 'weak cryptographic algorithms', design terminology like 'controlled inputs' and 'monitoring' trigger false security keywords, and Google Fonts URLs are legitimate external references for a design resource.
low_findings: Google Fonts URLs in typography data files (legitimate design resource)
Documentation URLs in framework guidelines (legitimate learning content)

content.value_statement: Developers and designers need consistent, accessible, and visually appealing interfaces but lack comprehensive design knowledge. UI/UX Pro Max provides instant access to 50+ design styles, color palettes, typography pairings, and framework-specific best practices through simple keyword searches.
actual_capabilities: Search and recommend UI design styles for any product type
Provide color palettes with hex codes for specific industries
Suggest typography pairings with Google Fonts imports
Recommend chart types and libraries for data visualization
Generate landing page patterns optimized for conversion
Provide framework-specific best practices for React, Vue, Next.js, and more
limitations: Does not generate actual code implementations - only provides design guidance
Does not validate accessibility compliance of user code
Does not access external design resources beyond embedded Google Fonts URLs
Search results are limited to pre-defined knowledge base content

use_cases.title: Implement design systems
use_cases.description: Quickly find framework-specific patterns and styling guidelines for consistent component development.

use_cases.title: Choose visual styles
use_cases.description: Discover appropriate design styles and color palettes for different product types and industries.

use_cases.title: Build landing pages
use_cases.description: Get conversion-optimized landing page patterns with color strategies and section ordering.

prompt_templates.title: Basic design query
prompt_templates.prompt: Find a color palette for a healthcare mobile app

prompt_templates.title: Framework guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me React performance best practices for large lists

prompt_templates.title: Landing page pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Get a hero-centric landing page pattern for a B2B service

prompt_templates.title: Complete design system
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a complete design system for a fintech dashboard including colors, typography, and UI style

output_examples.input: What color palette works for a luxury e-commerce brand?
output: Notes: Premium colors with minimal accent, elegant and sophisticated aesthetic

output_examples.input: What React pattern should I use for a form with complex state?
output: Do: Use reducer pattern when state has multiple related sub-values
Don't: Use multiple useState calls that update together

best_practices: Combine multiple search domains for comprehensive results (style + color + typography)
Use specific industry keywords to get targeted recommendations
Always check the UX guidelines domain to avoid common usability mistakes
Match the recommended UI style to your product type for cohesive design
anti_patterns: Using inconsistent color schemes across different sections
Ignoring accessibility guidelines when choosing styles
Applying decorative styles to functional elements
Forgetting to consider dark mode requirements

faq.question: Does this skill generate actual code?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides design recommendations and guidelines. You apply these to your own code.

faq.question: Can I use the color palettes in commercial projects?
faq.answer: Yes. All hex color codes are provided for direct use in web and mobile projects.

faq.question: Which frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter, and HTML with Tailwind.

faq.question: How do I find the right design style?
faq.answer: Search by product type (e.g., fintech, healthcare) or desired aesthetic (e.g., minimalism, glassmorphism).

faq.question: Are accessibility guidelines included?
faq.answer: Yes. Each style and framework guideline includes accessibility considerations and WCAG notes.

faq.question: How do I get Google Fonts URLs?
faq.answer: Search the typography domain to get font pairings with ready-to-use Google Fonts import statements.
